TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IResourceWriter implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides the base functionality for writing resources to an output file or stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Resource writers are used to write resources to files in a particular file format. Implement this interface if you want to control the way in which a resource file is written (for example, to store resources in something other than a .txt, .resx, or binary .resources file). Otherwise, use the default <xref:System.Resources.ResourceWriter> class, which writes resources to a binary .resources file, or the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> class, which writes resources to an XML resource (.resx) file.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddResource (string name, byte[] value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddResource(string name, unsigned int8[] value) cil managed

Docs.param: Value of a resource as an 8-bit unsigned integer array.
Docs.summary: Adds an 8-bit unsigned integer array as a named resource to the list of resources to be written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The resources are not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddResource (string name, object value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddResource(string name, object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a named resource of type to the list of resources to be written.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The resource is not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.
> [!NOTE] > `value` might have to be serializable, so you might have to provide a type converter, depending on which resource writer is used.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddResource (string name, string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddResource(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a named resource of type to the list of resources to be written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The resource is not written until the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes the underlying resource file or stream, ensuring all the data has been written to the file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If necessary, <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Close%2A> will call the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method to output the resources to the underlying file or stream before closing it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Generate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes all the resources added by the method to the output file or stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> does not close the output file or output stream. Instead, consider calling the <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Close%2A> method. <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> is useful when you want to create a resource file, but you don't want to close the output stream. <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A> can be called only once. After you call <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Generate%2A>, all <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter> methods other than <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter.Close%2A> will throw an exception.
